2.t: no soul will deny its coming.

3.t: It will abase some and exalt others.

4.t: When the earth is violently shaken

6.t: they will become like dust scattered around.

7.t: On that day, you (mankind) will be divided into three groups:

8.t: The people of the right hand - those whose books of records will be placed in their right hands. How happy they will be!

9.t: The people of the left hand - those whose books of records will be placed in their left hands. How miserable they will be!

10.t: The foremost ones (in faith and virtue) - the foremost ones in receiving their reward.

11.t: (The foremost ones) will be the nearest ones to God

13.t: Many of them will be from the ancient people

14.t: and only a few of them from the later generations.

15.t: They will recline on jewelled couches

18.t: with goblets, jugs and cups of crystal clear wine

19.t: which will not cause them any intoxication or illness.

20.t: Also, they will be served with the fruits of their choice

21.t: and the flesh of birds, as they desire.

22.t: They will have maidens with large, lovely black and white eyes,

23.t: like pearls preserved in their shells,

25.t: They will not hear any unnecessary or sinful talk
25.tr: Laa yasma'oona feehaa laghwanw Wa-laa taaseemaa

26.t: except each other's greetings of, "Peace be with you".

27.t: As for the people of the right hand, how happy they will be!

28.t: They will live amid the thornless lot trees

30.t: with fruits piled up one on the other,

36.t: that We have created (for the people of the right hand).

39.t: These (people of the right hand) consist of many from the ancient

40.t: and many from the later generations.

41.t: As for the people on the left hand, how miserable they will be!

42.t: They will live amid the scorching,

43.t: scalding water and under a shadow of black smoke,

44.t: neither cold nor graceful in shape.

45.t: They had lived in luxury before this

47.t: It was they who said, "Shall we be resurrected after we die and have turned into dust and bones?
47.tr: Wa-kaanoo yaqooloona a'izaa mitnaa Wa-kunnaa turaabanw Wa-izaaman 'ainnaa lamab'oosoon

48.t: Will our ancient forefathers be resurrected too?

49.t: (Muhammad), say, "All the ancient and later generations

50.t: will be brought together for an appointment on an appointed day.

51.t: Then you people who had gone astray and rejected the Truth

52.t: will eat from the fruit of the tree of Zaqqum,

54.t: and on top of this you will drink boiling water

56.t: Such will be their dwelling on the Day of Judgment.

57.t: It is We who have created you. Why then did you not testify to the Truth?

59.t: Did you create it or was it We who created it?

60.t: We have destined death for you and no one can challenge Us
60.tr: Nahnu qaddarnaa baina-kumul mawta Wa-maa nahnu bimasbooqeen

61.t: in replacing you with another creation like you, changing you into a form which you do not know.
61.tr: Alaaa an nubaddila amsaalakum Wa-nunshi'akum fee maa laa ta'lamoon

62.t: You certainly knew about (your) first development. Why do you not take heed?

63.t: Have you seen what you sow?

64.t: Do you make it grow or is it We who make it grow?

65.t: Had We wanted, We could have crushed it to bits and you would have been left to lament,
65.tr: Law nashaaa'u laja'al-naahu hutaaman fazaltum tafakkahoon

66.t: crying, "We have been left to suffer loss.

67.t: Surely, we have been deprived (of the benefits)".

68.t: Have you seen the water which you drink?

69.t: Is it you who sent it down from the clouds or is it We who have sent it down?
69.tr: A-antum anzaltumoohu minal muzni am nahnul munziloon

70.t: Had We wanted, We could have made it salty. Why then do you not give thanks?
70.tr: Law nashaaa'u ja'alnaahu ujaajan falaw-laa tashkuroon

71.t: Have you seen the fire which you kindle?

72.t: Is it you who have produced its tree or is it We who have produced it?
72.tr: A-antum anshaatum shajaratahaaa am nahnul munshi'oon

73.t: It is We who have made it as a reminder and a means of comfort for the people.

74.t: (Muhammad), glorify your Lord, the Great One.

75.t: I do not need to swear by the setting of the stars

76.t: - which is indeed a great oath if only you knew it -

77.t: that this is an honorable Quran

78.t: preserved in a hidden Book which

79.t: no one can touch it except the purified ones.

80.t: (This Quran) is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe.

81.t: Would you say that this statement is a lie?

82.t: Would you reject the sustenance that you receive rather than give thanks?

83.t: Why can you not help a soul dying

85.t: We are closer to him than you, but you cannot see.
85.tr: Wa-nahnu aqrabu ilaihi minkum Wa-laakil laa tubsiroon

86.t: If you are true to your claim that there is no Day of Judgment,

87.t: why can you not bring it (the soul) back (to life)?

88.t: (If a dying soul) is of those near to God,

89.t: it will have rest, happiness, and a beautiful Paradise.

90.t: If it is of the people of the right hand,
90.tr: Wa-ammaaa in kaana min as-haabil yameen

91.t: it will be with the people of the right hand, living in peace and security.

92.t: If it is of those who have rejected the Truth and have gone astray,
92.tr: Wa-ammaaa in kaana minal mukazzibeenad daaalleen

93.t: its dwelling will be boiling water

94.t: and the heat of hell fire.

95.t: This is the absolute Truth and certainty.

96.t: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Great One.
